newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador's public foreign debt at $12.64 bln.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's public foreign debt at $12.64 bln.

text.p: Ecuador's public foreign debt grew to $12.64 billion in 1996, a Central Bank report said Friday.
The public foreign debt in 1995 was $12.37 billion.
Private foreign debt stood at $1.93 billion in 1996.
Total foreign debt rose to $14.57 billion in 1996, up from $13.93 billion in 1995.
The president of Ecuador's pociy-setting Monetary Board said Friday the government would seek to renegotiate $2.0 billion in Paris Club debt because it hampers economic growth.
